III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has down syndrome and is toilet training. Staff modeled
toilet training for the youth to encourage the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
ABA Supervisor was interviewed via phone on June 11, 2024.
ABA Supervisor reported ABA Worker reported Staff 1 reported to
her he is modeling toileting for Youth A by urinating in front of him
and then encouraging Youth A to go. She reported Youth A is
non-verbal and has been working on learning appropriate toileting
skills. ABA Supervisor reported she has worked with Staff 1 when
doing ABA work with Youth A and noted no concerns. She
reported Staff 1 is very interactive within ABA therapy with Youth
A.
ABA Worker was interviewed via phone on June 18, 2024.
ABA Worker reported she directly worked with Staff 1 and Youth A
within the home. She reported during a session, Staff 1 reported
he modeled urination for Youth A and then placed Youth A on the
toilet which he then used. ABA Worker reported it was an odd
statement as she has never heard of someone modeling toileting
behaviors besides parents to their children. She reported Youth A
is a non-verbal youth and they have been working on toileting
techniques. ABA worker reported staff have been instructed to
take Youth A to the bathroom every hour and have him sit on the
toilet to get used to the feeling. She reported if Youth A uses the
bathroom correctly then staff are to praise him. ABA Worker
reported Staff 1 has always been willing to learn new skills to help
assist Youth A. She does not believe Staff 1 had any ill intent on
training Youth A to use the bathroom.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on June 11, 2024.
Administrator 1 reported ABA Supervisor reported these
allegations to her directly. She reported she had never heard of
these behaviors occurring with Staff 1. Administrator 1 reported
Staff 1 is a positive staff and is very involved in the growth of the
youth within the home.
Youth A is not verbal and could not be interviewed. Youth A
was seen in the home on June 12, 2024, and there were no
concerns noted.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 12,
2024. Staff 1 reported he has been working with the
developmentally disabled population for many years. He reported
he has attended ABA sessions with Youth A. Staff 1 reported one
of the main goals for Youth A is toilet training and he noted he did
tell the ABA Worker that he has been working on this goal with
him. He reported when he worked at another program with this
population many years ago, to help with toilet training staff would
do behavior modeling and it was beneficial. Staff 1 reported with
Youth A, about two or three times, he has urinated in the
bathroom to show Youth A. He reported he never showed Youth A
his genitalia but did model what to do and had him stand in the
area of the bathroom where he would not see Staff 1’s genitalia
but would be able to see/hear the urine go into the toilet. He
reported that he would have Youth A sit on the toilet and Youth A
was successful in using the toilet. He reported he never thought
this was inappropriate as this was something he did in previous
employment and mentioned what he did to ABA Worker regarding
Youth A’s success. Staff 1 reported there was no malicious intent
to the situation and due to Youth A being non-verbal, he thought
behavior modeling would help Youth A better succeed at the goal
of toilet training. He reported he does not remember the specific
days he has done this modeling behavior with Youth A and noted
that no other staff at the facility were aware of this. Staff 1
reported it is the staff’s job to help youth, especially Youth A, at
the facility with toileting. He reported the administration team did
talk to him about this modeling behavior and that he is not allowed
to. Staff 1 was responsive to the feedback and took responsibility.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately face to face
at the facility on June 12, 2024. Youth B and Youth C reported
they liked living at the facility and felt safe with all the staff. They
both noted they have never felt uncomfortable around any of the
staff or seen any staff do anything inappropriate. Youth B and
Youth C reported they liked it when Staff 1 worked and felt safe
and comfortable around them.
Administrator 1, Administrator 2, Administrator 3, and
Administrator 4 were interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 12, 2024. This consultant did a review of the allegations with
the administration team. Administrator 1 and Administrator 3
directly supervise Staff 1 and noted they have not had any
concerns with his ability to perform his role and noted that he is
one of the staff focused on helping the youth achieve their goals
within the program. Administrator 2 reported she plans on
updating their toileting policy to make sure it is clear how to
3

support youth when toileting. The team reported when they heard
of the concerns from ABA Supervisor, they talked with Staff 1
directly about the situation. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 took
full responsibility and stated that modeling this behavior was a
technique he learned in previous employment working with a
similar population many years ago. The administration team all
believed Staff 1 had no malicious intent with these actions and
was truly trying to assist Youth A in achieving his goal of toileting.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 12,
2024. Staff 2 reported she is a team lead at the home and helps
staff with assisting the youth in being successful with their goals.
She reported Youth A’s current goal is toilet training. Staff 2
reported she has been making sure Youth A is in the bathroom
every hour and sits on the toilet to use it. She reported when he
uses the toilet appropriately, he is given praise and sometimes
earns a reward. Staff 2 reported she has not heard or seen any
concerns about other staff toilet training with Youth A. She
reported she does work with Staff 1 and only has positive things to
say about him. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 is always looking out for the
best interest of the youth and wants them to be successful.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email with Foster Care Worker dated June 11, 2024-
Foster Care Worker reported she has not had any concerns
of Youth A’s care at the facility. She reported Youth A is a
non-verbal youth and at home, at school, and at ABA
therapy he is currently being potty trained to use the toilet
on his own.
- Staff 1’s Personnel File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions within his file. Staff 1 is up to date on all required
trainings, there was no specific training noted for toilet
training.
- Facility Toileting Assistance Policy dated March 11,
2022- This policy notes that if a youth needs assistance
with using the restroom, staff will assist. It also provides the
direction that staff should prompt youth every hour to use
the restroom. The policy does not have specifics on what to
do when toilet training a youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews and
documentation reviewed, Staff 1 had no malicious intent in training
Youth A to use the toilet. There is not enough evidence to support
Staff 1 exposed his genitals to Youth A.
Consultation:
4

Consultation was offered for the agency to provide Staff 1 some
coaching of using appropriate toilet training techniques with Youth
A. It is also recommended for the facility to update their toileting
assistance policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
